books.title: The Crime at Black Dudley
books.author: Margery Allingham
books.summary: The attendees of a party at a old mansion are threatened by a criminal kingpin.

books.title: Twenty Years After
books.author: Alexandre Dumas
books.summary: Four musketeers are drawn back together by current events after many years apart, try to save Charles I from Cromwell, and are pursued by the now-grown son of a former female adversary.

books.title: The Diary
books.author: Samuel Pepys
books.summary: The diary of a man living in London in the 17th century.

books.title: Personal Recollections of Joan of Arc
books.author: Mark Twain
books.summary: A fictional biography of Joan of Arc from her early teenage years to her martyrdom.

books.title: Heidi
books.author: Johanna Spyri
books.summary: A small girl is left with her grandfather and falls in love with his alpine home.

books.title: Something New
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: Two young writers experience romance and adventure in Lord Emsworth’s Blandings Castle.

books.title: Romeo and Juliet
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: The children of two opposing houses fall in love.

books.title: The Shaving of Shagpat
books.author: George Meredith
books.summary: A Persian barber embarks on a quest to save a city from the clutches of a tyrant and his magical hair.

books.title: Howards End
books.author: E. M. Forster
books.summary: The lives of three families of different classes intertwine in Edwardian England.

books.title: The King in Yellow
books.author: Robert W. Chambers
books.summary: Ten short stories of madness, hauntings, romance, and art.

books.title: The Mirror of the Sea
books.author: Joseph Conrad
books.summary: An autobiographical memoir on Joseph Conrad’s maritime experiences and his relationship with the sea.

books.title: The Secret of the Old Mill
books.author: Franklin W. Dixon
books.summary: The police are out of their depth as counterfeit bills circulate through the city, but two amateur sleuths are on the case.

books.title: Unspoken Sermons
books.author: George MacDonald
books.summary: George MacDonald presents a set of interlocking sermons designed to shape the perception and life of the Christian disciple.

books.title: Principia Ethica
books.author: G. E. Moore
books.summary: An analysis of the concept of good that diagnoses the history of ethics as being marred by the “naturalistic fallacy” while discussing intrinsic goods and evils.

books.title: Hudibras
books.author: Samuel Butler
books.summary: A knight and his squire set forth for adventure and love.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Edgar Allan Poe
books.summary: A collection of Edgar Allan Poe’s short fiction, ordered by date of publication.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Edgar Allan Poe
books.summary: A collection of Edgar Allan Poe’s short fiction, ordered by date of publication.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Voltairine de Cleyre
books.summary: A collection of all of the short stories written by Voltairine de Cleyre.

books.title: Siddhartha
books.author: Hermann Hesse
books.summary: A man embarks on a spiritual journey through India.

books.title: Roughing It
books.author: Mark Twain
books.summary: Mark Twain’s semiautobiographical account of his travel across the United States.
